column2: IOWA DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign is:
2. This road sign means:
3. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 4. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column8: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
6. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column6: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 7. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
9. Regulation signs normally are:
10. This sign means:
column10: You must yield the right-of-way ahead

column2: 11. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

column2: 12. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column6: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 13. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
column6: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.
column8: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.

column2: 14. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column10: turn left into the one-way road.

column2: 15. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
16. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
17. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: number of cars in front of you.
column10: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.

column2: 18. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column10: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 19. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column6: slow down gradually and brake lightly.

column2: 20. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 21. This yellow sign means:
22. Driver distractions include:
column4: Slowing down to look at crash scene.
column8: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.

column2: 23. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column6: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column10: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
25. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column6: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 26. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column6: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column8: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column10: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.

column2: 27. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
28. A steady green light at intersections means:
column8: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column10: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 29. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column8: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
column10: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.

column2: 30. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.
column6: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.

column2: 31. To drive defensively you should:
column4: keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
column6: always put one car length between you and the car ahead.
column8: look only at the car in front of you while driving.

column2: 32. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column8: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column6: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles
column10: You must make a complete stop

column2: 34. This road sign means:
35. There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
column4: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.
column6: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
column8: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.
